Responsibilities: 
Developer for Core Banking (Sliverlake Loans and Credit) 
To work on:
- DevOps
- ALDON (automation of software deployment on AS400) 
- Silverlake 
- Loans (systems that support lending products across the Bank for both the Retail and Wholesale business) 
- Limits (systems that manage counterparty credit limits at a relationship level both regionally and globally) 
- Collaterals (systems that support the lodgement, revaluation and release process for collaterals and related documents being held at Bank for secured loans) 

Mandatory Skills Description: 
• 6-9 years of experience 
• Cobol 
• Have done project based implementation in SDLC 
• Team management 
• Knowledge on Loans, Limits, Collateral, Provision, NPL
How do I create an account?
How do I reset my password?
How do I update my profile information?
How do I search for jobs?
How do I apply for a job?
Can I save jobs to apply later?
How do I contact support?
What is the difference between user and admin roles?
How do I use the messaging feature?
How do I set location preferences for job searches?
What is the process for reporting an issue?
How can I view my job application status?
To create an account, go to the sign-up page and enter your details
To reset your password, go to the login page and select “Forgot Password”
You can update your profile information in the Profile section under Settings
Use the search bar on the Jobs page to look for positions by keyword or location
Once you find a job you are interested in, click on Apply to start the application
Yes, you can save jobs by clicking the bookmark icon. View saved jobs in your profile
To contact support, go to the Help section and choose Contact Us to send a message
User role is for job seekers; Admin role has additional permissions for managing job posts
In the Community section, use the message icon to chat with companies and users...
Set location preferences in the Filter section on the Jobs page for customized results
To report an issue, go to the Report section, fill in the form, and submit it
You can check your application status under Applications in your profile section
